PrologDB

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • PrologDB.Table
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    KeyedTable

    public class Table
extends java.lang.Object
    a Table is an instance of a TableSchema. Both share the same names.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected TableSchema schema
      each table points to its tablesSchema "schema"

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Table(TableSchema schema)
      create an empty table for TableSchema schema

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Table add(Tuple t)
      adds tuple t to 'this' table; throws error the schema of the tuple does not match the schema of the table to which it is being added Untested precondition: that the schema of the tuple conforms to the schema of the table
      Table copy(TableSchema tableSchema)
      dup Table by copying each tuple and returning the copied Table.
      Table copyForSelfJoins(java.lang.String copyTableName)
      this method copies a table t for use in self-joins; the original table t is copied and renamed to copyTableName
      void delete(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      finds tuple with (key,value) pair and deletes the first
      Table filter(java.util.function.Predicate<Tuple> p)
      return a Table from a given Table that satisfies predicate p
      java.util.List<Column> getColumns()
      returns list of columns of the table; delegates to getColumns of TableSchema
      static java.lang.String getCSVName(java.lang.String pathName)
      returns the name of a csv file, sans ".csv" and any directory information linux example: "a/b/c.csv" returns "c" windoze example: "a\b\c.csv" returns "c"
      DBSchema getDBSchema()
      returns the DBSchema of this table.
      DBSchema getDBSchemaEH()
      returns the DBSchema of this table.
      Tuple getFirst(java.util.function.Predicate<Tuple> p)
      return first tuple in table that satisfies predicate p
      Tuple getFirstEH(java.util.function.Predicate<Tuple> p)
      return first tuple in table that satisfies predicate p
      java.lang.String getName()
      returns name of table, which always equals the name of its table schema
      TableSchema getSchema()
      returns schema of table
      java.util.List<Table> getSubTables()
      returns list of table + its subtables to search note: this method is really executed once.
      static Table join(Table innerTable, java.lang.String innerJoinKey, Table outerTable, java.lang.String outerJoinKey)
      this is a table constructor that takes the equijoin of innerTable on the innerJoinKey (column name) with outerTable on the outerJoinKey (column name).
      <S> S map(java.util.function.Function<Table,S> f)
      transform a table to an object of type S
      void print(java.io.PrintStream out)
      print table to PrintStream out
      Table project(java.util.List<Column> cols)
      project Table to a list of cols
      Table project(java.lang.String... colNames)
      project Table to an array of column names.
      Table project(TableSchema superTableSchema)
      projects a Table to the set of columns of a super table schema if given superTableSchema does not match any tuple in the list an Error is thrown
      static Table readTable(java.lang.String tableFilePath)
      reads and parses a prolog table from given string filename.
      int size()
      returns number of tuples in this table
      Table sort(java.lang.String columnName)
      sort 'this' Table on column with columnName
      java.util.stream.Stream<Tuple> stream()
      convert table into a stream of Tuples
      TupleList tuples()
      return list of Tuples of this table and all of its subtables no projection is done to ensure that all tuples have exactly and only the columns of its parents.
      TupleList tuplesLocal()
      return only the tuples of this table, and none of its subtables Generally not used; tuples() is preferred
      void writeTable(java.lang.String tablePathName)
      general writeTable file utility -- if filename ends in ".csv" then the table will be written in CSV format.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • schema

        each table points to its tablesSchema "schema"

    • Constructor Detail

      • Table

        public Table(TableSchema schema)
        create an empty table for TableSchema schema
        Parameters:
        schema - -- the schema to which the table should conform

    • Method Detail

      • copyForSelfJoins

        public Table copyForSelfJoins(java.lang.String copyTableName)
        this method copies a table t for use in self-joins; the original table t is copied and renamed to copyTableName
        Parameters:
        copyTableName - -- postfix name distinguisher
        Returns:
        copied table

      • readTable

        public static Table readTable(java.lang.String tableFilePath)
        reads and parses a prolog table from given string filename. may throw parseExceptions or Errors, which terminates processing. Errors are reported to PrintStream out.
        Parameters:
        tableFilePath - is the filename of the Prolog database
        Returns:
        Table of tableFilePath

      • map

        public <S> S map(java.util.function.Function<Table,S> f)
        transform a table to an object of type S
        Type Parameters:
        S - -- return type, should not be Table or subclass of Table
        Parameters:
        f - -- a function that maps a Table to S
        Returns:
        -- object of type S

      • filter

        public Table filter(java.util.function.Predicate<Tuple> p)
        return a Table from a given Table that satisfies predicate p
        Parameters:
        p - -- predicate to satisfy
        Returns:
        predicate reduced TupleList

      • project

        public Table project(TableSchema superTableSchema)
        projects a Table to the set of columns of a super table schema if given superTableSchema does not match any tuple in the list an Error is thrown
        Parameters:
        superTableSchema - -- schema of supertable to project to
        Returns:
        column-projected Table

      • project

        public Table project(java.util.List<Column> cols)
        project Table to a list of cols
        Parameters:
        cols - - List of columns
        Returns:
        projected Table

      • project

        public Table project(java.lang.String... colNames)
        project Table to an array of column names. precondition: each name must correspond to an existing column in schema
        Parameters:
        colNames - - List of column names
        Returns:
        projected TupleList

      • join

        public static Table join(Table innerTable,
                         java.lang.String innerJoinKey,
                         Table outerTable,
                         java.lang.String outerJoinKey)
        this is a table constructor that takes the equijoin of innerTable on the innerJoinKey (column name) with outerTable on the outerJoinKey (column name). The crossproduct of both schemas is formed, and the joined table is returned.
        Parameters:
        innerTable - -- inner table of join
        innerJoinKey - -- join key of inner table
        outerTable - -- outer table of join
        outerJoinKey - -- join key of outer table
        Returns:
        equijoin of innerTable and outerTable

      • copy

        public Table copy(TableSchema tableSchema)
        dup Table by copying each tuple and returning the copied Table. Unchecked Precondition: this.tableSchema must have an identical set of columns as tableSchema. Only the names of their schemas may be different
        Parameters:
        tableSchema - -- table schema of the list
        Returns:
        copied tuple list

      • sort

        public Table sort(java.lang.String columnName)
        sort 'this' Table on column with columnName
        Parameters:
        columnName - -- name of (string) column to sort
        Returns:
        columnName sorted TupleList

      • add

        public Table add(Tuple t)
        adds tuple t to 'this' table; throws error the schema of the tuple does not match the schema of the table to which it is being added Untested precondition: that the schema of the tuple conforms to the schema of the table
        Parameters:
        t - is tuple to add
        Returns:
        updated Table ('this');

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.String key,
                   java.lang.String value)
        finds tuple with (key,value) pair and deletes the first
        Parameters:
        key - -- column
        value - -- column value

      • getDBSchema

        public DBSchema getDBSchema()
        returns the DBSchema of this table. If there is no such DBSchema null is returned.
        Returns:
        DBSchema of this table

      • getDBSchemaEH

        public DBSchema getDBSchemaEH()
        returns the DBSchema of this table. if there is no DBSchema (i.e., it is null) an Error is thrown
        Returns:
        DBSchema of this table

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        returns name of table, which always equals the name of its table schema
        Returns:
        name of table

      • getSchema

        public TableSchema getSchema()
        returns schema of table
        Returns:
        TableSchema of 'this' table

      • getColumns

        public java.util.List<Column> getColumns()
        returns list of columns of the table; delegates to getColumns of TableSchema
        Returns:
        list of columns of this table

      • tuples

        public TupleList tuples()
        return list of Tuples of this table and all of its subtables no projection is done to ensure that all tuples have exactly and only the columns of its parents.
        Returns:
        list of tuples of this table and all of its subtables

      • tuplesLocal

        public TupleList tuplesLocal()
        return only the tuples of this table, and none of its subtables Generally not used; tuples() is preferred
        Returns:
        list of tuples of only 'this' table

      • getFirst

        public Tuple getFirst(java.util.function.Predicate<Tuple> p)
        return first tuple in table that satisfies predicate p
        Parameters:
        p - - filter or query, usually over a key field
        Returns:
        null if there is no such tuple, or the first tuple

      • getFirstEH

        public Tuple getFirstEH(java.util.function.Predicate<Tuple> p)
        return first tuple in table that satisfies predicate p
        Parameters:
        p - - filter or query, usually over a key field
        Returns:
        tuple ; throws error if not found

      • size

        public int size()
        returns number of tuples in this table
        Returns:
        number of tuples in this table

      • getSubTables

        public java.util.List<Table> getSubTables()
        returns list of table + its subtables to search note: this method is really executed once. By doing so, the "subtables" member of "this" is set to the list of previously computed subtables.
        Returns:
        list of all tables for the given table, which includes the table itself

      • getCSVName

        public static java.lang.String getCSVName(java.lang.String pathName)
        returns the name of a csv file, sans ".csv" and any directory information linux example: "a/b/c.csv" returns "c" windoze example: "a\b\c.csv" returns "c"
        Parameters:
        pathName - is the path-name to a csv file
        Returns:
        cvs file name

      • print

        public void print(java.io.PrintStream out)
        print table to PrintStream out
        Parameters:
        out - -- PrintStream to output print

      • writeTable

        public void writeTable(java.lang.String tablePathName)
        general writeTable file utility -- if filename ends in ".csv" then the table will be written in CSV format.
        Parameters:
        tablePathName - -- file path name

      • stream

        public java.util.stream.Stream<Tuple> stream()
        convert table into a stream of Tuples
        Returns:
        stream of table tuples
